page.title: 03PARKGATE RAWMARSH
page.content: Parkgate, which is an area south of Rawmarsh, is in a development zone. The steel works which were a prominent feature of the landscape have all been demolished, leaving areas of derelict land. Streets of terraced houses which had been built at the end of the 19th century for the workers in the growing steel and coal industries, have also been demolished. New light industrial premises are being built where once there were streets. Public buildings such as chapels have also been converted for commercial use. Many of the shops, in a once thriving shopping street, have been converted to finance, building society, or insurance offices, or banks. On the road to Rotherham there are hills of tipped industrial waste. There are streets of derelict houses with second hand shops packed with junk.
